data.question: What is the purpose of using a thermolabile tert-butoxycarbonyl (Boc) protecting group in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: The thermolabile tert-butoxycarbonyl (Boc) protecting group is used to protect organocatalytic units during MOF synthesis and then unveiled by a simple postsynthetic heating step, which endows the resulting MOF with catalytic activity.

data.question: What is the role of bulky Boc groups in the synthesis of open MOFs?
data.answer: The bulky Boc groups prevent framework interpenetration, producing open MOFs that can admit relatively large substrates.

data.question: True or False: The removal of the Boc protecting group does not affect the pore volume of the MOF framework.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of using IRMOF-Pro-Boc for asymmetric aldol reactions?
data.answer: IRMOF-Pro-Boc, upon conversion to IRMOF-Pro, exhibits catalytic activity for asymmetric aldol reactions due to the unveiled proline moiety.

data.question: How is the proline unit in the ligand protected during MOF synthesis?
data.answer: The proline unit of the ligand is protected by a Boc group, which prevents its protonation or coordination to zinc(II) under the conditions of MOF synthesis.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of IRMOF-Pro-Boc involves a solvothermal reaction with Zn(NO3)2 in DEF.
data.answer: True

data.question: What method is used to determine the temperature at which the Boc groups can be expelled from IRMOF-Pro-Boc?
data.answer: Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) is used to determine the temperature at which the Boc groups can be expelled.

data.question: True or False: The conversion of IRMOF-Pro-Boc to IRMOF-Pro does not involve microwave irradiation.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the effect of thermolysis temperature on the enantiopurity of the proline groups in IRMOF-Pro?
data.answer: Lowering the thermolysis temperature to 150 Â°C led to only a marginal improvement in the enantiopurity (ee) of the proline groups.

data.question: True or False: The structure of IRMOF-Pro as determined by X-ray crystallography shows that it is suitable for heterogeneous catalysis.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the BET surface area of IRMOF-Pro as determined by N2 gas sorption experiments?
data.answer: The BET surface area of IRMOF-Pro is 138 m2 g-1.

data.question: True or False: IRMOF-Pro-Boc shows catalytic activity towards aldol reactions before the removal of the Boc group.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the diastereomeric ratio (dr) of the aldol product when cyclopentanone and 4-nitrobenzaldehyde are used as reactants with IRMOF-Pro as the catalyst?
data.answer: The diastereomeric ratio (dr) of the anti to the syn products is 75:25.

data.question: True or False: The enantiomeric excess (ee) of the aldol product improves significantly when IRMOF-Pro is used as the catalyst.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main reason for the modest enantioselectivities observed for the aldol reactions catalyzed by IRMOF-Pro?
data.answer: The modest enantioselectivities may be ascribed to a lack of organization in the reaction transition state due to several factors, including motion of the catalytic unit with respect to the framework.

data.question: True or False: The strategy for incorporating organocatalytic groups into MOFs ensures that there is vacant space around the catalytic unit.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of bulky protective groups in the synthesis of MOFs with organocatalytic groups?
data.answer: Bulky protective groups preclude framework interpenetration, producing open networks.

data.question: True or False: The general methodology for the introduction of organocatalytic groups into MOFs can be applied to any MOF.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the expected outcome of the current efforts to produce second-generation catalysts with improved enantioselectivities?
data.answer: The current efforts are focused on thermolabile groups that enable participation of both the proline nitrogen atom and its carboxyl group in the catalytic cycle within MOFs.

data.question: True or False: The initial focus of the work was to develop a highly enantioselective catalyst.
data.answer: False
